title: Experiencing Lag and Performance Issues with Xbox Cloud Gaming on Firefox – Any Fixes or Recommended Settings?
content:
Hi Firefox Community,

I’ve recently started using Xbox Cloud Gaming (xCloud) through the browser on my PC, and I’m currently using Firefox as my main browser. However, I’ve been encountering some issues while playing:

Noticeable input lag during gameplay

Occasional frame drops and stuttering

Delayed response times compared to when using other browsers like Edge or Chrome

I really prefer using Firefox for privacy and customization, so I’d like to stick with it if possible. The performance issues seem to be more pronounced in fast-paced games, making them difficult to enjoy.

Here’s what I’ve tried so far:

Ensured Firefox is up to date

Disabled unnecessary add-ons and extensions

Cleared cache and cookies

Tested with hardware acceleration on and off

Internet connection is stable (wired, 200 Mbps)

Despite these steps, the performance still doesn’t match what I get in other browsers.

Is anyone else experiencing similar issues with Xbox Cloud [[Gaming|https://whatmobiles.net.pk/product/infinix-note-50-pro-price-in-pakistan/]] on Firefox? Are there any recommended browser settings, configurations, or tweaks that can optimize Firefox for cloud gaming performance?

Any advice, tips, or solutions would be greatly appreciated. I’d really like to continue using Firefox without compromising my gaming experience.

Thanks in advance!
creator: tahashk00

title: Experiencing Lag and Performance Issues with Xbox Cloud Gaming on Firefox – Any Fixes or Recommended Settings?
content:
Hi Firefox Community,

I’ve recently started using Xbox Cloud Gaming (xCloud) through the browser on my PC, and I’m currently using Firefox as my main browser. However, I’ve been encountering some issues while playing:

Noticeable input lag during gameplay

I really prefer using Firefox for privacy and customization, so I’d like to stick with it if possible. The performance issues seem to be more pronounced in fast-paced games, making them difficult to enjoy.

Here’s what I’ve tried so far:

Disabled unnecessary add-ons and extensions

Cleared cache and cookies

Tested with hardware acceleration on and off

Despite these steps, the performance still doesn’t match what I get in other browsers.

Is anyone else experiencing similar issues with Xbox Cloud Gaming on Firefox? Are there any recommended browser settings, configurations, or tweaks that can optimize Firefox for cloud gaming performance?

Any advice, tips, or solutions would be greatly appreciated. I’d really like to continue using Firefox without compromising my gaming experience.

Thanks in advance!

title: Sites unresponsive when using Firefox + VPN
content:
As of a few days ago (potentially coinciding with the most recent update?) I've had several websites become varying degrees of unresponsive when using Firefox while being connected to a VPN (Nord, in this case).

Some sites will load but then get throttled--i.e. YouTube will load and (usually) populate thumbnails, but clicking on a video will result in the video instantly dropping to its lowest available resolution, playing for a few seconds, and then stalling. Interestingly(?) if I try to watch a live stream, chat will be fully functional but the video will be unable to load. Other sites will load but then very quickly stop responding at all. Others are straight up just not loading period, while many others have no issues at all.

I've cleared my cache, deleted cookies for the affected sites, tried Firefox in a private window, tried Firefox with no extensions, and reinstalled both Nord and Firefox to no avail. All of the affected sites are fully functional so long as I'm not connected to a VPN, and are also fully functional on other browsers, even while connected to a VPN. All other non-browser related applications that require the internet are also unaffected, and my internet speeds in general aren't showing any issues.

I've been unable to find any other chatter about this anywhere, and I unfortunately don't have any other devices available to try and replicate the issues. I would not be surprised if it was one of those wonderful Me Exclusive DNS issues or something, but figured it was worth throwing out there.
creator: frootjoose

title: urgent, PLEASE help!  "access denied" errors that settings don't seem to fix
content:
Need help with this problem, and need it desperately and quickly! So much so, that I bothered to actually make an account here to beg for help. I've been getting an "access denied" error on some websites. First it was mouser, and I had to phone in an order. They claimed that there were no problems with the website, and no other customers were reporting issues at the time. Started researching the problem, and discovered various "fixes" seem to revolve around the various security and privacy settings. NONE of these alleged "fixes" actually work! Continued to research the problem, and still haven't found a solution that actually works. Next it was lowe's website, so can no longer comparison shop with them (at least they have plenty of competitors). Now, it's ups, and did not discover this until I just ordered a bunch of stuff and have almost a dozen packages to track! HELP! PLEASE! Mail theft is a HUGE problem in this area, and I need to know exactly when all these deliveries are arriving! Here's all my info, as best as I have it or know it: Linux OS FF was updated to v137, this was one of the first things done in attmpting to solve the problem when it first happened. Cookies, cache, history, etc are always cleared, I only go to one website at a time, and clear all this stuff out, close, and then reopen FF before I go to another website. Clearing this stuff out and then refreshing the page (a commonly mentioned "solution") doesn't work. Privacy and tracking protection was changed from "custom" (with everything checked), to "standard". "Do not track" was changed, and turned off (unchecked) "Website advertising preferences" was not changed from the unchecked setting, since none of the affected websites contain advertising. "Certificates / query OCSP responder servers" was left checked. "Don’t enable HTTPS-Only Mode" was left checked. "DNS over HTTPS" was changed from "max protection" to "default". "Use your default DNS resolver" was changed from unchecked to checked. "Play DRM-controlled content" was left unchecked. "No proxy" is checked in the "network settings".

Generally speaking, the various "solutions" proffered seem to involve turning off or minimizing any privacy protections. No one specific thing I've seen mentioned has solved the problem. And attempting to "open up" all of these settings hasn't worked at all. So, first, am I somehow missing something? Is there some privacy protection buried in the settings that I haven't been able to find and "open up"?

Secondly, WHY is this happening? (This question is being asked on a technical level, I'm trying to understand this and learn something here) In my understanding of attempting to research the problem, it is somehow something that some websites are doing to protect themselves against bots and DDOS attacks - OR (and?) - is a way of forcing tracking and datamining onto those who still attempt to cling to some notion of privacy. What exactly are these websites doing, that causes this error with FF, but not other browsers? Why does this error occur with FF, and not other browsers?

Right now, the urgent need is being able to track these deliveries so that hundreds and hundreds of dollars worth of merchandise and supplies don't get stolen! Somebody, PLEASE HELP! TIA!
creator: none

title: What can you tell me about seeking a career in cyber security?
content:
Pursuing a career in cybersecurity is both a vital and fulfilling choice, particularly in today’s digital-first world. With cyber dangers getting to be more modern, organizations over all businesses are contributing intensely in securing their information and frameworks. This request has made a wide extend of work openings, from moral hacking and arrange security to occurrence reaction and security examining. Whether you're fair beginning out or looking to move from another IT part, cybersecurity offers a energetic career way with ceaseless learning and development potential.

To start a career in cybersecurity, having a solid establishment in IT essentials like organizing, working frameworks, and programming is basic. Numerous experts begin by winning industry-recognized certifications such as CompTIA Security+, CEH (Certified Moral Programmer), or CISSP (Certified Data Frameworks Security Proficient). These qualifications not as it were approve your abilities but too make you more alluring to bosses. Enlisting in specialized preparing programs or cybersecurity courses can moreover fast-track your learning and give commonsense, hands-on experience.

One of the interesting perspectives of cybersecurity is its ever-evolving nature. Dangers alter quickly, which implies experts require to remain current with the most recent devices, strategies, and patterns. This consistent advancement makes the field savvy people invigorating but too requests a commitment to deep rooted learning. Taking part in workshops, going to security conferences, and locks in with cybersecurity communities can offer assistance you remain ahead.

Moreover, cybersecurity parts frequently come with great compensation prospects and work security due to the tall request and moderately moo supply of qualified specialists. Whether you select to work for government organizations, tech companies, money related teach, or as an free specialist, the career adaptability is unmatched. If you're energetic approximately problem-solving, appreciate specialized challenges, and need to make a genuine affect, cybersecurity is a field worth investigating.

content: Hi, hey I forgot my PIN that allows my to view my passwords. The bubble that pops up says "You can reset your PIN by going to Settings > Accounts > Sign-in options". I'm not seeing it. Firefox Settings search is of no help. Any Ideas? Thank you.

title: search history
content: My search history has disappeared. View/history shows a blank page. If I select "history" from the menu, "recently closed tabs" and "recently closed windows" are grayed out, and "recent history" is empty. But I've been to a dozen or more sites today. What can I do to make Firefox record my history?
